form.label: ASD Essential 8 - User application hardening - Details

html.p: Block web browser access to Adobe Flash Player (uninstall if possible), web ads and untrusted Java code on the Internet. Flash, Java and web ads have long been popular ways to deliver malware to infect computers. This page provides details on what applications with Java user agents are communicating through your proxy and enabled flash and advertisements.

When reviewing this dashboard you should pay attention to the domains that are allowed through the proxy such as web advertisements and flash. Use this list to inform strategies to mitigate attacks that leverage Flash, Java and web advertisements.

panel.title: Allowed Flash and Shockwave by Domain

search.query: | tstats values(Web.user) as user count from datamodel=Web where (nodename=Web.Proxy (Web.http_content_type=*Shockwave* OR Web.http_content_type=*Flash* OR Web.http_user_agent="Java*" OR http_user_agent="*flash")) by Web.dest | sort -count | rename dest as Domain
| tstats values(Web.user) as user count from datamodel=Web where (nodename=Web.Proxy (Web.dest=*Ads*)) by Web.dest | sort -count | rename dest as Domain

panel.title: Example data sources to power this dashboard

ul.li: Web Proxy Data - Symantec Bluecoat, Websense, Squid Proxy or ZScaler. These sources must log Allows and Blocks to provide accurate data
Assett Inventory Data - Microsoft Active Directory, CMDB, SCCM. These sources must log the hostnames and usernames to allow comparison to proxy data.
